q: UNTIL JAN 23, 3:00 p.m. BERKELEY- Treasurer Bill Lockyer said Saturday that if lawmakers fail to quickly adopt significant budget cuts, the state could be forced to begin issuing IOUs beginning in May. Depending on whether cuts are made soon, we may have to have IOUs go out in May, he said during a luncheon speech at a political seminar. Controller John Chiang, who would be responsible for making such a decision, has not publicly warned of that possibility. "I'm not supposed

Eric Schmidt became chief executive in 2001, leading the company alongside its co-founders Larry Page and Sergey Brin . universe."[ 2] In that desire to vindicate comes an equal temptation to shape the events favorably, a desire that Donald Rumsfeld seems not to have escaped, as Fred Kaplan points out at Slate: Many autobiographies exhibit[ the tendency to self-aggrandizement] to some extent. It can even be tolerable if it's joined to an engaging style or sage insights about broader matters. Donald Rumsfeld 's book has no such redeeming features. And even if it did, its distortions and lies( I use the term advisedly) are just too blatant to be countenanced. Rebuttal, indeed.[ 1] G.W.
